Html: Line 140 of MefModuleManager in Drop 9 still has the incorrect comparison of ModuleType.Name and moduleinfo.ModuleName. What exactly does code complete mean. Does that just mean they'll be no more features added and now it's about bug fixing?

Hi,

Thanks for reporting this, since it is really valuable. I will notify about this to the product team. In general, when the code is completed the future drops may contain bug fixes but there are not new features.

Other users interested on this topic can vote here. For more information, you could take a look at this forum thread.

Thanks for your feedback again.

Fernando Antivero 
http://blogs.southworks.net/fantivero

Hi,

I think that you can find interesting that the problem in the MefModuleManager.ModuleNeedsRetrieval has been solved in the latest drop (10) of prism. You can download it from here.

Thanks again for your feedback, since it is really valuable.

Fernando Antivero 
http://blogs.southworks.net/fantivero

Thanks! I received the email update from the work item as well.
